723088f-a.text:
Rutgers Street, west side, north from, but not including Cherry Street.
June 6, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.
723088f-a.folder: Rutgers Street & Cherry Street, Manhattan, NY

718728f-a.text:
Cherry Street, west from and across Rutgers Slip, showing mainly, buildings on the north side of this thorofare this side of the Manhattan Bridge (causeway seen). To the left is the small park that is in the center the Slip and extends from Cherry to South Streets.
View 1: June 6, 1930
View 2: April 23, 1939
P.L. Sperr
718728f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Rutgers Street, Manhattan, NY

718728f-b.folder: Cherry Street & Rutgers Street, Manhattan, NY

718725f-c.text:
Cherry Street, east from a point (No. 264, tenement at left in No. 2) slightly above Rutgers Street.
View 1 favors the southerly side with stables thereupon. A clearance appears at Jefferson Street. View 2 is of the tenements on the opposing side. The W.P.A. slum clearance demolition seen is a portion of a wide program designed to enforce rehabilitation. This site was formerly occupied by tenements that bore No's. 266 and 26?. A notice of ???? appeared in the N. Y. Sun of February 23, 1939.
Beyond is a 6 story stables that adjoins the Beth Israel Hospital. The latter is at the S. W. corner of Jefferson Street. The lower portions of these features are depicted in View No. 3.
View 1: June 17, 1936
Views 2,3: April 23, 1939
F. L. Sperr
718725f-c.folder: Cherry Street & Rutgers Street, Manhattan, NY

718723f-b.text:
Cherry Street, norh side, west from (No. 244), but not including Rutgers Street, to the Manhattan Bridge (west of Pike Street). The stables in the foreground, are Nos. 242-238, and are between Rutgers
and Pelham Streets.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
A view further westward, and showing across the empty lot at the N.E. corner of Pelham Street, the buildings on the west side of the
same, at and adjoining the N.W. corner.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
The same as No. 2, but in the opposite direction, and showing prominently the empty lot at the N.E. corner of Pike Street. The building shown being demolished is No. 222. Cherry Street.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
718723f-b.folder: Cherry Street & Rutgers Street, Manhattan, NY

718729f-b.text:
(1)
Cherry Street, west from (No. 244) but not including Rutgers Street, showing an anchorage of the Manhattan Bridge, as it straddles the street slightly west of Pike Slip. Shown on the south side of the street (left)
is a lumber yard and scrap-iron dump.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, showing an exclusive view of the south side of the street,
and including a portion of the Manhattan Bridge.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
718729f-b.folder: Cherry Street & Rutgers Street, Manhattan, NY

718730f-a.text:
246 to 260 Cherry Street, north side, at Rutgers Street, as seen, north on Rutgers Slip (foreground) from Water Street. No. 250 and 248-246 appear in View No. 1, at and adjoining the N.W. corner while Nos. 256 to 260 appear in No. 2, at, adjoining and east of the N.N. corner. Also shown (a continuation of the Slip, when north of Cherry Street) is Rutgers Street of which Nos. 66 to 52 appear on the west side, north from Cherry to Monroe Streets. The small playground area shown in the foreground is in the center of the Slip and extends the length of the Slip (2 blocks) between South and Cherry Streets. This set of two views was taken on
the same date.
March 22, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
718730f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Rutgers Street, Manhattan, NY

718727f-a.text:
Cherry Street, east from and including Rutgers Street. This view shows mainly the north side. The building lettered with signs, is No. 6l Rutgers Slip and is at the N.E. corner.
March 21, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
718727f-a.folder: Cherry Street & Rutgers Street, Manhattan, NY

723076f-a.title: Manhattan: Rutgers Slip - Cherry Street
723076f-a.text:
Rutgers Slip, east side, south from Cherry, to and including Water Streets. Also shown is Cherry Street, south side, east from and including Rutgers Slip.
June 17, 1936.
P. L. Sperr.
723076f-a.folder: Rutgers Slip & Cherry Street, Manhattan, NY
